## Description {#details}

An error that has already been reported.

This class is designed to support a function whose callers may need to know whether the function encountered and reported an error but never need to know the nature of that error. For example, the function has a return type of <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a></code> and always returns either <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/errorreported">ErrorReported</a></code> or <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/errorsuccess">ErrorSuccess</a></code>. That interface is similar to that of a function returning bool to indicate an error except, in the former case, (1) there is no confusion over polarity and (2) the caller must either check the result or explicitly ignore it with a call like <code>consumeError</code>.

Definition at line 545 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/filecheck/filecheckimpl-h">FileCheckImpl.h</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### convertToErrorCode() {#ae865fcdb49b67ee1665118c059a8f790}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::error&#95;code llvm::ErrorReported::convertToErrorCode () const</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Convert this error to a std::error&#95;code.

This is a temporary crutch to enable interaction with code still using std::error&#95;code. It will be removed in the future.
